result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Recore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Sentence to commence forthwith.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case Nos. 2016CF000081, 2016CF000231 and any other sentence currently being served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 1/3/2017 - Request for Furlough Denied

16CF-81, 16CF-231 AND 16CM-157 - All cases called @ 1:37 PM:   Defendant Cody A. Recore in court with Attorney John B. Selsing.  Scot Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA Blader.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing as to Ct 1 of 16CF-231.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court makes probable cause finding and Def BOT.  INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of potential punishment as to each charge.  Agrees w/one other conviction as recited by Court (OWI).  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim present and will wish to speak.  16CF-81:  Ct 2 Plea w/Enh: NC.  16CM-157 Ct 1 w/Enh Plea:  NC.  Plea Ct 2:  NC.  16CF-231 Ct 1 Plea:  NC.  Ct 4 Plea (OWI 2):  NC.   Court accepts  all pleas and enters JOC.  16CF-81 - Ct 1 DRI.  16CF-231:  Ct Nos 2, 3, 5, 6 & 7 all DRI.  3 companion civil citations all DRI.  Victim present and makes statement.  Argument by DA Blader - 90 days each count is appropriate.  Argument by ATTY Selsing - argues for lesser probation term with 90 Day WCJ and to include GT credit.  Statement by Def: Apologizes to the Court.  The Court:  Court addresses victim directly.  Accepts resolution.  16CF-81 Ct 2: S/W -  2 yrs probation:  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru; Ab Sob; FT employment; DAAP or its equivalent - 90 days WCJ concurrent to any existing sentence; Court Costs plus DNA sample/surcharge.  16CF-231:  Ct 1:  S/W 3 yrs probation.  Conditions:  180 days WCJ with 35 days TS credit - balance to be served forthwith, concurrent to any other SEH being served; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs - 60 DTP plus DNA Surcharge/Sample.  Ct 2 (OWI 2): 30 days WCJ concurrent to other SEH - $1379 fine; $42.50 Blood Draw fee; 16 mos DL Rev/IID/AODA - Def encouraged to get Occ DL as soon as able due to IID requirement.  16CM-157:  Both Counts 90 days WCJ concurrent to each other and any other SEH imposed; any contact with victim left to agent's discretion - only contact permitted is by text message or email and solely must be limited to matters pertaining to the children in common.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
from Victim, Dated 11/30/2016 Re: Amendment of Bond - Request for Contact

10:48 am cases called.  16CF81 & 16CM157. Defendant Cody A. Recore in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Selsing regarding new charges in another jurisdiction and his client's position. Statement by DA regarding scheduling. Court schedules matter for trial. Court makes statement regading final pretrial with all motions being filed within 72 hours of hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Final pre-trial on December 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 5, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Selsing requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

3:46 pm cases called-16CF81 & 16CM157. Defendant Cody A. Recore in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matters on calendar. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of personal appearance of Attorney Selsing.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:55 pm.
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 02:55 pm.
Status conference on May 25, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:16 pm case called. Defendant Cody A. Recore in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Cody A. Recore in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
